thread.title: Houston Astros Say Tal's Hill Renovation Won't Happen Before 2016
thread.title_full: Houston Astros Say Tal's Hill Renovation Won't Happen Before 2016

author: Louis Milman
title: Houston Astros Say Tal's Hill Renovation Won't Happen Before 2016
text:
Share Article 
Photo by Scott Halleran/Getty Images (HOUSTON) -- Planned renovations at Houston's Minute Maid Park, including the removal of the famous Tal's Hill, will be put off for at least another year, the Houston Astros announced Thursday.Over the summer, the Astros had announced plans to renovate the stadium, including the elimination of the hill, which is in play in centerfield. "Through the bidding process, we determined that the construction timelines to have the ballpark ready for Opening Day 2016 became too risky, and we decided it was in everyone's best interest to postpone the renovation," team President of Business Operations Reid Ryan said in a statement. #Astros to postpone center field renovation pic.twitter.com/iBe44bTUO0 — Houston Astros (@astros) October 15, 2015 The renovation attempts would have been impacted by both the Major League Baseball playoffs -- the Astros were just eliminated on Wednesday -- and by a scheduled international cricket match in November.
Tal's Hill is the only on-field hill in baseball, and features a flag pole that is also in-play. Concerns about player safety have been brought up since the ballpark's construction in 2000.
